zone.line: in me to burn untill oll all be cold,
and stiff, and dead. Yet I will not die;
alas: I dare I how dare I go where
I may meet Diana, when I have
disobeyed her last request; o th her
last words said in a faint voice when
all feeling but love, which survives
all things else was already dead, when
she ^then told n told ^bade me to make her child
happy: that thought alones gives a
double sting to death. I will wander
away from you, away from all life
â€“ in the solitude I shall seek I alone
shall breathe of human kind. I must
endure life; and as it is my duty so
I shall untill the grave dreaded yet
desired, receive me free from pain:
While I for while I feel it will be
pain that must make up the
whole sum of my sensations. Is not
this a fearful curse that I labour
under? Do I not look forward to a
miserable futurity? My child, if after
